question:
Recently, the Union Ministry of Health and Family Welfare (MoHFW) launched National Deworming Initiative on the occasion of National Deworming Day. In this context, consider the following statements:
  1. The initiative aims to create mass awareness among all stakeholders regarding control of Soil-Transmitted Helminth (STH) infections
  2. The National Deworming Day is observed on 15th February
Which of the above statements is/are correct?
explanation: <u>First statement is correct</u>. National Deworming Initiative aims to create mass awareness among all stakeholders regarding control of Soil-Transmitted Helminth (STH) infections. <u>Second statement is incorrect</u>. The National Deworming Day is observed on 10<sup>th</sup> February. The ministry through this initiative is promoting the Albendazole tablets. This tablet has no side effects and has been used by many people around the world. On NDD every year, single dose of Albendazole is administered to children from under 1 to 19 years of age group through platforms like schools and Anganwadi centres.
